How to play:
a. start a game
you can either join games big groups in /grouplist@werewolfbot or you can add @werewolfbot to your own groups and start the game in your groups with friends.
b. what is werewolf
Werewolf is a text based game where there is a village. Most of the people are villagers and some of them are werewolves. The game cycles through day and night. During the day the whole village votes to lynch someone and at night the werewolves choose someone to kill. The villagers win when all of the werewolves are dead. The werewolves win when there are more werewolves than villagers

table.name: wwfaqbot
table.column:
A few people are getting banned for flooding the bot. Let me explain a few things here:
Spamming a command is not some kind of magic. Hitting a command 40 times will not make anything magical happen. It's like the button on an elevator - pressing it multiple times is not a secret passcode or anything.
The spam detection is actually quite lenient. If you hit it, you were seriously spamming it. The bot also warns you before it bans you.
Here's the bigger reason why this happens though - Everytime you hit a command, it's meant to get a response from the bot. Each time the bot has to send a command, it counts towards the API limit. So spamming a command reaches the bot towards API limits, and lags the bot for EVERYONE. This is why we are very strict about spamming the bot - if you do it enough for the bot to auto-ban you, that's on you. You were given a warning and continued to spam the bot.

table.name: wwfaqbot
table.column: How to get in the grouplist?

To add your group to the grouplist, first find out if it's a public or private groups! Public groups have usernames, like @werewolfcommittee, while private groups have invite links, like https://telegram.me/joinchat/B7EXdD1l2nZnyyHrsP0ZYw ! A public group should automatically appear on the list, but a private group must be added by their admin. To do that, just use the setlink command! Usage is as follows: /setlink https://telegram.me/joinchat/B7EXdD1l2nZnyyHrsP0ZYw If it doesn't work, please try /setlink@werewolfbot or /setlink@werewolfIIbot, depending on which bot is in your group!
Please keep in mind that each language\'s list only has the top 10 biggest groups! If your group is smaller than all of them, it won\'t appear until it gets bigger!

table.name: wwfaqbot
table.column: Why sk didn't kill harlot too, difference between sk/ww kills

The difference between a Serial Killer and a Werewolf is that, while a Werewolf chooses a house to attack and kills everyone inside (and only the people inside), the Serial Killer chooses a victim, tracks them to wherever they are and kills only them, regardless of who else is in the house.
That means a wolf will not be able to kill a harlot if she's not home, but will kill one if she's at his chosen house... And a serial killer won't kill a harlot if she's at his victim's house, but will kill a harlot if he chooses her as his victim regardless of whose house she's in.

table.name: wwfaqbot
table.column:
Differently from Normal Mode, in which roles are distributed according to the number of players in the game (for example, a 5-people game will only have Drunk, Villager, Wolf and Tanner as possible roles), Chaos Mode will take roles randomly from all of the available roles in the game and distribute them to players regardless of how many are in the game - so, while a Normal game would only have a Serial Killer if it had at least 25 players, a Chaos game could have one in a 5-people game.
There are some rules Chaos Mode follows when deciding roles, though! Cultists will only be available as a role in games with more than 10 people, and no Chaos game should ever start out with more than 1/6 of its population being a wolf (Cursed, Traitor etc is not counted)!

To smite a player (or multiple players!), just mention them after your smite command! Your message should look like this: /smite @username1 @username2
If they don't have an username, you can also mention by name by typing @ and then following with their name!
If they both don't have an username and aren't in the group anymore, you can also smite by id! Find out a user's ID by replying to one of their messages with /id if you have Werewolf Enforcer on your group, or by forwarding one of their messages to @userinfobot if you don't. Once you have that player's ID, smite by using /smite 00000000 (in which 00000000 is the user's ID)
(Smiting used to work by reply, but it doesn't anymore)

table.name: wwfaqbot
table.column: 1. Start a game using /startgame or /startchaos. After the game is started, everyone can /join. 2. When the game start, the bot will pm you your role. It will contain your role name and your ability and when to use it (if any). 3. The game will start at night phase. At this time, cupid, wild child, and Doppelganger will choose the target of their abilities. 4. At night phase, night players will be contacted to use their ability. Choose the target from the list sent by the bot. The result will be pm'd by the bot at the end of the night. 5. After certain time or after all the night players uses all their abilities, the game enter day phase. At this phase, day players can use their abilities. Choose the target from the list sent by the bot by pm. The result will be apparent by the bot at the end of the day. 6. At daytime, the players can argue within the village on who to lynch until the end of the day. At the end of the day, the players can vote by choosing from the list sent by the bot via pm. The recipient of most votes will be killed. In case of tie, no one will be lynched. 7. After lynching is over, the game shifts into night phase. 8. Repeat no. 4 - 7 until a team wins.

table.name: wwfaqbot
table.column:
There are at least 2 teams: 1. Team village. Objective: to lynch all opposing teams 2. Team werewolf. Objective: To survive until half the population is werewolf. Each night, team werewolf can feast on someone.
After a certain number of player (and/or in chaos mode), we have other teams: 3. Team Cult. Objective: to convert all the population into cultists. Each night, team cult can try to convert someone.
There are some individual who have specific win conditions, too: 4. Serial Killer. Objective: to survive alone in the village. Each night, the serial killer can kill someone. 5. Tanner. Objective: to be lynched by the village. 6. Lovers. Not a proper team but a trait shared by two people: if one dies, the other will follow. It also gives special win condition to both lovers: if one win, the other will also win, regardless of their teams. For example, if the lovers is a tanner and a werewolf, if the tanner is lynched, the werewolf will also die. But because the tanner wins, the werewolf will also win while the other werewolves (if any) lose. Try to survive as the last two people standing to get special Lovers Ending!

table.name: wwfaqbot
table.column: Why doesn't the players list show up?

Players list is now automatically sent at the end of each day / lynch / night cycle, IF a player has died / fled. Running /players will not send the whole list, but simply reply to the most recent list. Less spam in large groups!
If the game has not started yet, there is no latest list for the bot to reply to, and it will not send one.
